channel.description: The top News headlines from The Sydney Morning Herald. For all the news, visit https://www.smh.com.au
channel.title: Sydney Morning Herald - Latest News

item.description: The US President is confronting a crisis that could undercut badly needed support in the military community for his re-election campaign.
item.title: Trump angrily denies report he called fallen soldiers 'losers' and 'suckers'

item.description: The 30-year-old man was found on a life raft waving for help two kilometres off an island, but there was no news about the fate of two missing Australians.
item.title: Third crewman from capsized ship rescued on life raft off Japan

item.dc:creator: Bevan Shields
item.description: The former Australian prime minister will serve as one of 12 advisers to the United Kingdom's new-look Board of Trade, an appointment that has set off a major political dispute in Westminster.
item.title: British government defies backlash to approve Tony Abbott as new trade adviser

item.description: The model, which has been cited by the White House coronavirus taskforce, forecasts that US deaths could soar to 3000 per day in December.
item.title: US coronavirus deaths projected to more than double to 410,000 by year's end

item.description: The finest photos from the international wire agencies as chosen by our picture editors.
item.title: The best of the world in pictures

item.dc:creator: Peter Ryan
item.description: The Brisbane Lions lost key defender Harris Andrews and Collingwood lost consistent link man Tom Phillips to hamstring injuries at the Gabba on Friday night with both expected to be missing until finals.
item.title: Lions and Pies lose key players until finals with hamstring injuries

item.dc:creator: Adele Ferguson
item.description: The scandal-ridden icare was in turmoil on Friday as it scrambled to announce the sudden departure of its second most senior executive
item.title: Who else needs to scream before real change happens at icare?

item.dc:creator: Alex Druce
item.description: The dividend game in Australia has changed. Both in how much to expect in your pocket, and where it’s going to come from.
item.title: 'Iron ore miners are the new banks': New roadmap for dividends on the ASX

item.dc:creator: Elizabeth Farrelly
item.description: The surprising lake of ignorance that lies behind our food obsessions is the core subject of a fascinating new book.
item.title: Anyone who eats anything, ever, should buy this curiously hybrid book

item.dc:creator: Charlotte Grieve
item.description: A deed of release offered to retiring AMP financial planners would force them to compensate the company for any damages related to class actions.
item.title: AMP contract prevents planners from joining class action

item.dc:creator: Sean Kelly
item.description: Only the very best politicians have it in them: the ability to look at what you’ve said and done, and admit it’s stopped working.
item.title: To restore the nation's fortunes, Morrison must not only appear humble he must be humble

item.dc:creator: John Silvester
item.description: “Whenever anybody got in the way ... Elliott, O'Bryan and Symons turned to threats and intimidation.”
item.title: O'Bryan's fall: How a legal eagle's wings were clipped by greed

item.description: Based on comments from the Treasurer and PM, creativity and ingenuity are in short supply.
item.title: Desperate situation not enough to inspire creativity

item.description: To Palestinian farmers in the Jordan Valley such as Rashed Khudairi, Israeli policy remains as it has been for decades: take over the land, exclude the people.
item.title: In the Jordan Valley, international deals don't change Israeli policy

item.dc:creator: Kate McClymont
item.description: Backroom efforts will be made over the weekend to force George Coorey’s hand to resign from the chairmanship, following revelations he sent a woman a lewd message.
item.title: 'Sleazy' chairman George Coorey digs in at Canterbury League Club

item.dc:creator: Lydia Lynch
item.description: Queensland has pledged to work with the federal government to reopen its borders to southern states in time for Christmas if it's safe to do so.
item.title: Queensland backs national approach to declaring COVID-19 hotspots

item.dc:creator: Chris Barrett
item.description: The broadcaster has opened the door to reclaiming the rights to Test cricket it held for 40 years as Seven threatens to walk away from the game.
item.title: Nine boss keen on return to cricket broadcasting 'at the right price'

item.dc:creator: Tony Moore
item.description: A Brisbane theatre open since 1936 is reaching out for emergency help as COVID-19 restrictions cripple its audiences and its revenue.
item.title: COVID could bring curtain down on Brisbane's little big theatre

item.dc:creator: Adam Pengilly
item.description: He's 35 years old, hasn't played in the NRL for six years nor a game of rugby league for six months. Can Williams still be a force?
item.title: In twilight of his career, can Sonny Bill Williams still land a blow?

item.dc:creator: Anna Patty
item.description: Security experts have warned marginalised Australians are at risk of adopting conspiracy theories.
item.title: Pandemic linked to rise of conspiracy theories

item.dc:creator: David Crowe
item.description: Australia's biggest employers are forecasting an investment surge to create 500,000 jobs in a bid for a permanent tax break in the October budget to speed up the recovery from recession.
item.title: Use $10 billion a year to create 500,000 jobs: business

item.dc:creator: Jewel Topsfield
item.description: Disease and disasters have long been fertile ground for conspiracy theories, but COVID-19 and the internet age have created a perfect storm.
item.title: The other virus: distrust rides high on the back of COVID-19

item.dc:creator: Julia Naughton
item.description: The former triple j presenter never thought he’d be the dad who spoke about baby milestones over brunch. But then he welcomed his daughter and all that changed.
item.title: Matt Okine: 'I had such a naive image of being a new dad'

item.dc:creator: Carolyn Cummins
item.description: Small to medium investors are defying market jitters and taking advantage of the low interest-rates to snap up $350 million in higher-yielding bricks and mortar assets.
item.title: Small investors defy market jitters as big end deals retreat

item.dc:creator: Nicole Lindsay
item.description: A new generation office tenant has arrived. YouTube blogger Slazo has leased space at the End to End office complex in Collingwood.
item.title: YouTube blogger streams into Collingwood office

item.description: Phillip Island's most famous attraction has a new visitor centre that is heroic and inspiring.
item.title: Penguins parade around 'heroic' new visitor centre

item.dc:creator: Linda Morris
item.description: Two months after rallying to save it from shut down, Sydneysiders have been invited to contribute ideas for the Powerhouse Museum's renewal at Ultimo.
item.title: Powerhouse Museum asks its community: give us your ideas

item.description: It's time for the behemoths of social media to pay their dues.
item.title: Don't let journalism go the way of the cassette tape

item.dc:creator: Andrew Hornery
item.description: The founders of lifestyle website Sporteluxe, Bianca Cheah and Simon Chalmers deny they have fled Sydney to escape creditors.
item.title: Sydney glamour couple stay in LA owing investors $2 million

item.description: It's nearly a year since the Supreme Court of NSW found a Sydney glamour couple had misled potential investors.
item.title: Tablet interactive: Sydney glamour couple stay in LA despite Aussie debts

item.dc:creator: Nick Miller
item.description: Melbourne Now 2013 was a blockbuster success, showcasing the city's best art, design and performance. The National Gallery of Victoria hopes to raise millions of dollars for a 2023 sequel.
item.title: NGV reveals plans for an art extravaganza to lift the city's spirits

item.description: There’s a common thread between attitudes to men knitting and those that leave women trying to conduct Zoom meetings while looking after the kids’ schooling, working out what’s for dinner and cleaning the toilet.
item.title: Knitting has soared in popularity, but where are the men?

item.dc:creator: George Megalogenis
item.description: Twin leadership examples demonstrate what is missing in Morrison's response to the pandemic.
item.title: Menzies would be rolling in his grave at Morrison's failure to defend every job

item.description: The news of the day as interpreted by our talented artists, illustrators and cartoonists.
item.title: Best of cartoons, September 5, 2020

item.dc:creator: Michael Fowler
item.description: "You can't lock down five million people in Melbourne because you have a certain number of healthcare workers who are contracting COVID-19," says epidemiologist Professor Catherine Bennett.
item.title: Victoria could move to reopen as new cases largely restricted to health workers, experts say

item.description: The experience of parenthood for first-time dads has been greatly altered by lockdown, but many dads are loving being able to spend more time with their baby.
item.title: 'Special moments': new dads learn life lessons in lockdown

item.dc:creator: Benjamin Preiss
item.description: The fire service is hoping to recruit newcomers to regional Victoria as it adopts new procedures for battling summer fires amid the threat of new coronavirus outbreaks.
item.title: CFA hopes sea- and tree-changers will bolster volunteer base

item.dc:creator: Melissa Cunningham
item.description: Experts are imploring Victorian authorities to adopt statewide benchmarks including hard deadlines that ensure positive cases and their close contacts are interviewed, tested and quarantined within two days.
item.title: Top infectious disease experts call for a 48-hour turnaround of contact tracing in Victoria

item.description: Modern life has made many of us feel more isolated than is healthy. Then the world went into lockdown and the age of loneliness turned chronic.
item.title: 'The world's greatest psychological experiment': When the loneliness epidemic met the coronavirus pandemic

item.dc:creator: Chip Le Grand
item.description: The corruption-busting QC appointed following Queensland's Fitzgerald royal commission says Daniel Andrews must appoint a special prosecutor to investigate police implicated in the Lawyer X scandal.
item.title: Will anyone make Gobbo police face the courts?

item.dc:creator: Danny Katz
item.description: I emptied my compost bin into a wheelbarrow… and there it was! A massive pile of wonderful nutrient-rich… kitchen garbage.
item.title: A public apology to my neighbours Beck and Rick

item.dc:creator: Zoe Samios
item.description: The Trump administration has weighed in on a world-first piece of legislation that would require Facebook and Google to pay for news in Australia.
item.title: Trump administration concerned about Australia's tech giant crackdown

item.description: The news of the day as interpreted in the work of our award-winning cartoonists.
item.title: Today's cartoons: The illustrated news

item.description: The best photos from the international wire agencies as chosen by our picture editors.
item.title: Gallery: The best photos from around the world

item.dc:creator: Peter Ryan
item.description: The Brisbane Lions poured on the pressure in the second quarter to push the Magpies out of contention for the top four.
item.title: Brisbane Lions topple Magpies to keep Gabba grand final dreams alive

item.description: A week in photos from the award winning Sydney Morning Herald and Australian Financial Review photographers
item.title: Photos of the week, September 3, 2020

item.dc:creator: Christian Nicolussi
item.description: Souths were chasing six straight wins and for the opening hour on this wet Friday night looked ready to celebrate skipper Adam Reynolds' 200th game in style.
item.title: 'It was a metre forward': Smith's contentious clutch play sinks Souths

item.description: Shannon Harvey's is a straight-talking and insightful introduction to the subject.
item.title: Non-fiction reviews: My Year of Living Mindfully and three other books

item.dc:creator: Lydia Lynch
item.description: Party Treasurer Stuart Fraser and Young LNP President Nelson Savanh have both resigned from the state executive this week.
item.title: Mass exodus at LNP headquarters two months out from Queensland election

item.dc:creator: Rachael Dexter
item.description: Major aged care outbreaks are likely to blame for Parkville and East Brighton topping lists for active cases in this week's Melbourne postcode coronavirus data.
item.title: Aged care clusters likely driving top active coronavirus postcodes
